chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child
Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (fewer than 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant David L. Buss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (fewer than 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child

supervisions.notes: Defendant was granted 40 days credit for time served.  There is a uncharged read-in count on this case from St. Croix County.

superMiscConds.notes: Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.

Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.

Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request
Defendant is to complete a sex offender assessment and do any recommended treatments.

The defendant shall have no contact with R. A. F. or J. B. of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  Defendant is not to have contact with any person under the age of 18 without prior approval of his agent. 
Defendant shall not seek nor maintain any type of employment that includes over-the-road travel, door to door sales, or other such comparable type of work is required or any work that interacts with children.

The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.
Defendant is to comply with all the requirements of the Sex Offender Registration Program.
Restitution consists of any past or future counseling for the victims

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
